medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in infancy, with persistent secretory diarrhea noted at four weeks of age. Duration included recurrent diarrhea leading to weight loss below the third percentile. Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus diagnosed at 2.5 months and ichthyosis observed two weeks after birth, progressively worsening. Other issues included hemolytic anemia at four weeks, requiring multiple blood transfusions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The child had a family history of similar medical issues, with a deceased brother who suffered from intractable diarrhea and other conditions attributed to IPEX. The mother had experienced a spontaneous abortion and had four healthy daughters. Not specified conditions confirmed through biopsies included villous atrophy.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had a son who died at 4.5 months of age from conditions related to IPEX, including intractable diarrhea.
